sen.j: 伊吹山（いぶきやま、いぶきさん）は標高1,377.3m、滋賀県と岐阜県の県境にある伊吹山地の主峰。
sen.e: Mt. Ibuki (Ibuki yama or Ibuki san,) is 1,377.3 meters high and the main mountain in the Ibuki mountain range located in the border between Shige and Gifu Prefecture.
Mt. Ibuki (Ibuki yama or Ibuki san,) is 1,377.3 meters high and the dominant peak in the Ibuki mountain range located in the border between Shige and Gifu Prefecture.
Mt. Ibuki (Ibuki yama or Ibuki san,) is 1,377.3 meters high and the dominant peak in the Ibuki mountain range located in the border between Shige and Gifu Prefecture.

sen.j: 滋賀県最高峰の山であり、日本百名山のひとつでもある。
sen.e: It is the highest mountain in Shiga Prefecture and one of the hundred most celebrated mountains in Japan.
It is the highest mountain in Shiga Prefecture and one of the hundred most celebrated mountains in Japan.
It is the highest mountain in Shiga Prefecture and one of the hundred most celebrated mountains in Japan.

sen.j: 琵琶湖国定公園の一部。
sen.e: It is a part of Lake Biwa Quasi National Park.
It is a part of the Lake Biwa Quasi-National Park.
It is a part of the Lake Biwa Quasi-National Park.

sen.j: 三角点が置かれている頂上は、滋賀県米原市に位置する。
sen.e: The top of the mountain where the triangulation point is placed is in Maibara City, Shiga Prefecture.
The top of the mountain where the triangulation point is placed is in Maibara City, Shiga Prefecture.
The top of the mountain where the triangulation point is placed is in Maibara City, Shiga Prefecture.

sen.j: 古くから霊峰とされ、日本武尊が山の神との戦いに敗れ傷を負った地とされる。
sen.e: From ancient days, it has been considered as a holy mountain where Yamatotakeru was defeated by the god of the mountain and injured.
From ancient days, it has been considered as a holy mountain where Yamatotakeru was defeated by the god of the mountain and injured.
From ancient days, it has been considered as a holy mountain where Yamatotakeru was defeated by the god of the mountain and injured.

sen.j: また古代には三関のひとつである不破関が置かれた。
sen.e: In ancient days, fuwanoseki, one of three seki (a checkpoint), was placed.
In ancient days, fuwanoseki, one of three seki (a checkpoint), was placed.
In ancient days, fuwanoseki, one of three seki (a checkpoint), was placed.

sen.j: これらの経緯から伊吹山は古来より歌枕として知られる。
sen.e: With these circumstances, Mt. Ibuki has been known as utamakura (places used in waka, a genre of classical Japanese verse) since ancient days.
With these circumstances, Mt. Ibuki has been known as utamakura (a place famed in classical Japanese poetry) since ancient days.
sen.cmt: 用語集に統一しました。
sen.e: With these circumstances, Mt. Ibuki has been known as utamakura (a place famed in classical Japanese poetry) since ancient days.

sen.j: 山麓から山頂にかけて、様々な野草が自生するお花畑がある。
sen.e: There are flower fields with a variety of wild grass spreading from the foot to the top of the mountain.
There are flower fields with a variety of wild grass spreading from the foot to the top of the mountain.
There are flower fields with a variety of wild grass spreading from the foot to the top of the mountain.

sen.j: 景観は高山の高茎草原そのものの様相をみせる。
sen.e: The landscape is just grasslands with alpine plants.
The landscape is just grasslands with alpine plants.
The landscape is just grasslands with alpine plants.

sen.j: おもなものとしてルリトラノオ、ニッコウキスゲ、メタカラコウ、ハクサンフウロ、クガイソウ、オオバギボウシ、シシウド、シモツケソウなどがある。
sen.e: The main plants are Veronica longifolla, Daylily, Ligularia stenocephala, Geranium yesoemse.Fr.et.Sav.var.nipponicum Nakai, Scrophlulariaceae, Hosta montana, Angelica sp.L., Filipendula auriculata Kitam.

The main plants are Ruritorano (Veronica subsessilis), Nikkokisuge (Hemerocallis middendorffii var. esculenta), Metakarako (Ligularia stenocephala), Hakusanfuro (Geranium yesoemse var. nipponic), Kugaiso (Veronicastrum sibiricum), Obagiboshi (Hosta montana), Shishiudo (Angelica pubescens), Shimotsukeso (Filipendula multijuga).
sen.cmt: 用語集に統一しました。
sen.e: The main plants are Ruritorano (Veronica subsessilis), Nikkokisuge (Hemerocallis middendorffii var. esculenta), Metakarako (Ligularia stenocephala), Hakusanfuro (Geranium yesoemse var. nipponic), Kugaiso (Veronicastrum sibiricum), Obagiboshi (Hosta montana), Shishiudo (Angelica pubescens), Shimotsukeso (Filipendula multijuga).

sen.j: またイブキレイジンソウ、イブキアザミ、コイブキアザミ、イブキジャコウソウ、イブキトリカブトといった「イブキ」の名を冠する植物も自生する。
sen.e: Also, the names of some plants are prefixed by 'Ibuki' such as Ibukireijinso (Aconitum chrysopilum Nakai), Ibukiazami (Cirsum confertissimum var. herbicola), Koibukiazami (Cirsum confertissimum), Ibukijakouso (Tymus serpyllum L. subsp. quinquecostatus Kitam), Ibukitorikabuto (Aconitum japonicum var. ibukiense).

Also, the names of some plants are prefixed by 'Ibuki' such as Ibukireijinso (Aconitum chrysopilum Nakai), Ibukiazami (Cirsum confertissimum var. herbicola), Koibukiazami (Cirsium confertissimum), Ibukijakoso (Thymus quinquecostatus), Ibukitorikabuto (Aconitum japonicum Thunb. var. ibukiense (Nakai) Tamura).
sen.cmt: 用語集に統一しました。
sen.e: Also, the names of some plants are prefixed by 'Ibuki' such as Ibukireijinso (Aconitum chrysopilum Nakai), Ibukiazami (Cirsum confertissimum var. herbicola), Koibukiazami (Cirsium confertissimum), Ibukijakoso (Thymus quinquecostatus), Ibukitorikabuto (Aconitum japonicum Thunb. var. ibukiense (Nakai) Tamura).

sen.j: 1927年（昭和2年）2月14日に11.82mの積雪が観測された。
sen.e: On February 14, 1927, the snow accumulated to a depth of 11.82 meters.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: On February 14, 1927, 11.82 meters of snow accumulation was observed.
sen.cmt: 訳漏れ「観測された」を補足しました。
sen.e: On February 14, 1927, 11.82 meters of snow accumulation was observed.

sen.j: これは世界山岳気象観測史上1位とされる積雪の世界記録である。
sen.e: It is the world record of snow accumulation in the world mountains meteorological observation history.
sen.cmt: 世界山岳気象観測史の定訳が見つからなかったので、 the world mountains meteorological observation history.としました。 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: It is the world record of snow accumulation in the world mountains meteorological observation history.
It is the world record of snow accumulation in the world mountains meteorological observation history.

sen.j: しかし、この記録は吹き溜まりの影響を受けているとの指摘もある。
sen.e: However, some people point out that snowdrift contributed to this record.
However, some people point out that snowdrift contributed to this record.
However, some people point out that snowdrift contributed to this record.

sen.j: 伊吹山は数千万年前に噴火した海底火山であった。
sen.e: Mt. Ibuki was a submarine volcano which erupted tens of millions of years ago.
Mt. Ibuki was a submarine volcano which erupted tens of millions of years ago.
Mt. Ibuki was a submarine volcano which erupted tens of millions of years ago.

sen.j: その時期ににサンゴ礁が出来たため良質の石灰岩が産出する場所として知られている。
sen.e: Around that time, coral reefs were formed, therefore, it is known as a place where good limestone is produced.
Around that time, coral reefs were formed, therefore, it is known as a place where good limestone is produced.
Around that time, coral reefs were formed, therefore, it is known as a place where good limestone is produced.

sen.j: 近代のコンクリート・セメント需要の急増により、伊吹山の石灰岩も大量に採掘されてきた。
sen.e: Due to a sharp rise in demand for concrete and cement in the modern times, limestone in Mt. Ibuki has been mined in large volume.
Due to a sharp rise in demand for concrete and cement in the modern times, limestone in Mt. Ibuki has been mined in large volume.
Due to a sharp rise in demand for concrete and cement in the modern times, limestone in Mt. Ibuki has been mined in large volume.

sen.j: 右の国友や琵琶湖からの写真にて白く見える場所が採掘した跡である。
sen.e: As shown in the picture, the place which looks white in Kunitomo and Lake Biwa is the site of mining.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: As shown in the picture, the place which looks white in Kunitomo and Lake Biwa is the site of mining.
As shown in the picture, the place which looks white in Kunitomo and Lake Biwa is the site of mining.

sen.j: ある程度の植生の回復が見受けられる。
sen.e: There is a sign of revegetation to some extent.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: There is a sign of revegetation to some extent.
There is a sign of revegetation to some extent.

tit.cmt: 交通アクセスと解釈しました。

sen.j: 1965年に岐阜県関ヶ原町から山頂近くまでの「伊吹山ドライブウェイ」が開通した。
sen.e: In 1965, 'Mt. Ibuki Highway' between Sekigahara cho, Gifu Prefecture and around the top of the mountain was opened.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: In 1965, 'Ibukiyama driveway' between Sekigahara cho, Gifu Prefecture and around the top of the mountain was opened.
sen.cmt: 用語集に統一しました。
sen.e: In 1965, 'Ibukiyama driveway' between Sekigahara cho, Gifu Prefecture and around the top of the mountain was opened.

sen.j: 名阪近鉄バスの定期登山バスが休日や夏休みなどに関ヶ原駅・大垣駅から運転されている。
sen.e: Meihan Kintetsu Bus Corporation regularly provides mountain bus service from Sekigahara and Ogaki Station on holydays including weekends and summer vacation.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Meihan Kintetsu Bus Corporation regularly provides mountain bus service from Sekigahara and Ogaki Station on holydays including weekends and summer vacation.
Meihan Kintetsu Bus Corporation regularly provides mountain bus service from Sekigahara and Ogaki Station on holydays including weekends and summer vacation.

sen.j: また1993年からは大阪駅桜橋口、2003年からは名古屋駅からの伊吹山山頂行きの名神ハイウェイバスが運転されている。
sen.e: Also, 'Meishin Highway Bus' (bus running on an expressway) bound for the top of Mt. Ibuki was opened from Osaka Station, Sakurabashi Gate in 1993 and from Nagoya Station in 2003.
Also, 'Meishin Highway Bus' (bus running on an expressway) started operating bus services bound for the top of Mt. Ibuki, from Osaka Station, Sakurabashi Exit in 1993 and from Nagoya Station in 2003.
sen.cmt: started operating bus servicesを加えました。
sen.e: Also, 'Meishin Highway Bus' (bus running on an expressway) started operating bus services bound for the top of Mt. Ibuki, from Osaka Station, Sakurabashi Exit in 1993 and from Nagoya Station in 2003.

sen.j: 伊吹山ドライブウェイは近畿日本鉄道が所有し、名阪近鉄バスが運営を行ってきた。
sen.e: Mt, Ibuki Highway' had been owned by Kintetsu Corporation and run by Meihan Kintetsu Bus Corporation.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理 近畿日本鉄道の英語名 http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E8%BF%91%E7%95%BF%E6%97%A5%E6%9C%AC%E9%89%84%E9%81%93
sen.e: Ibukiyama driveway' had been owned by Kintetsu Corporation and run by Meihan Kintetsu Bus Corporation.
sen.cmt: 用語集に統一しました。
sen.e: Ibukiyama driveway' had been owned by Kintetsu Corporation and run by Meihan Kintetsu Bus Corporation.

sen.j: しかし、2006年にオーストラリアの投資銀行であるマッコーリー銀行の子会社である日本自動車道に譲渡し、近鉄および名阪近鉄バスは伊吹山ドライブウェイの運営から撤退した。
sen.e: However, in 2006, it was transferred to Japan Automobile Road Corporation, a subsidiary of Macquarie Bank, an Australian investment bank and Kintetsu and Meihan Kintetsu Bus Corporation withdrew its management.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理 日本自動車道の英語名 http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E6%97%A5%E6%9C%AC%E8%87%AA%E5%8B%95%E8%BB%8A%E9%81%93
sen.e: However, in 2006, it was transferred to Japan Automobile Road Corporation, a subsidiary of Macquarie Bank, an Australian investment bank and Kintetsu Corporation and Meihan Kintetsu Bus Corporation withdrew from its management.
sen.cmt: 用語集に統一しました。Fromを追加しました。
sen.e: However, in 2006, it was transferred to Japan Automobile Road Corporation, a subsidiary of Macquarie Bank, an Australian investment bank and Kintetsu Corporation and Meihan Kintetsu Bus Corporation withdrew from its management.

sen.j: なお、名阪近鉄バスの登山バスはこれまで通り運転される。
sen.e: But, Meihan Kintetsu Bus continues to provide mountain bus service.
But, Meihan Kintetsu Bus continues to provide mountain bus service.
But, Meihan Kintetsu Bus continues to provide mountain bus service.

sen.j: 伊吹山は中京圏および京阪神地区からそれほど遠くない位置にあり、かつ麓を東海道本線や名神高速道路が通じているので交通の便の良がよい。
sen.e: Mt, Ibuki is not so far from Chukyo area and Keihanshin area and it is conveniently located with Tokaido Main Line and Meishin Expressway running through the food of the mountain.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Mt, Ibuki is not so far from Chukyo area and Keihanshin area and it is conveniently located with Tokaido Main Line and Meishin Expressway running through the foot of the mountain.
Mt, Ibuki is not so far from Chukyo area and Keihanshin area and it is conveniently located with Tokaido Main Line and Meishin Expressway running through the foot of the mountain.

sen.j: また、多くの伝説が残された名山としての知名度が高い。
sen.e: Also, it is a well-known mountain with a lot of legends.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Also, it is a well-known mountain with a lot of legends.
Also, it is a well-known mountain with a lot of legends.

sen.j: さらに、夏季に山頂近くを彩る高山植物を含む野草群のお花畑と、9合目までドライブウェイで登れるという手軽さもある。
sen.e: Additionally, in the summer, it has a huge filed of wild grass and alpine flora on the top and visitors can easily get to the ninth station by car.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Additionally, in the summer, it has a huge filed of wild grass and alpine flora on the top and visitors can easily get to the ninth station by car.
Additionally, in the summer, it has a huge filed of wild grass and alpine flora on the top and visitors can easily get to the ninth station by car.

sen.j: こうしたことから、人気のある観光地として親しまれている。
sen.e: For these reasons, it gains popularity as a sightseeing spot.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: For these reasons, it gains popularity as a sightseeing spot.
For these reasons, it gains popularity as a sightseeing spot.

sen.j: 主な観光コースは9合目駐車場まで自家用車やバスで登り、その後、遊歩道で山頂に至るものである。
sen.e: The main tourist course is; you drive to the ninth station by car or bus, then, stroll on a path for walkers to the top.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: The main tourist course is; you drive to the ninth station by car or bus, then, stroll on a path for walkers to the top.
The main tourist course is; you drive to the ninth station by car or bus, then, stroll on a path for walkers to the top.

sen.j: 遊歩道は3コースあり、山歩きに適した靴の着用が望ましい。
sen.e: It has three paths for walkers you can choose and wearing shoes suitable for mountain hike is recommended.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: It has three paths for walkers you can choose and wearing shoes suitable for mountain hike is recommended.
It has three paths for walkers you can choose and wearing shoes suitable for mountain hike is recommended.

sen.j: このうち西遊歩道は坂が緩やかで一番上りに適している。
sen.e: Of these three paths, the west path has a gentle slope, so, it is the most suitable for climbing up.
Of these three paths, the west path has a gentle slope, so, it is the most suitable for climbing up.
Of these three paths, the west path has a gentle slope, so, it is the most suitable for climbing up.

sen.j: 中央遊歩道は山頂へ直登するもので、もっとも急坂であるため下り向けである。
sen.e: The middle path directly run up to the top, so, it is the steepest and suitable for climbing down.
The middle path directly run up to the top, so, it is the steepest and suitable for climbing down.
The middle path directly run up to the top, so, it is the steepest and suitable for climbing down.

sen.j: 東遊歩道はあまり整備されておらず下り専用（案内看板より）である。
sen.e: The east path is not kept in good condition, so, it is only for climbing down (according to the sign).
The east path is not kept in good condition, so, it is only for climbing down (according to the sign).
The east path is not kept in good condition, so, it is only for climbing down (according to the sign).

sen.j: 山頂部には5軒の山小屋が密集している。
sen.e: There are swarms of five mountain huts on the top.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: There are swarms of five mountain huts on the top.
There are swarms of five mountain huts on the top.

sen.j: これらの山小屋は、昼(10~16)は売店として営業しているほか、ご来光を待つ観光客や登山者のために、一部の小屋では仮眠のための宿泊も可能となっている。
sen.e: They are open during daytime (10 to 16) as a stand and some of them also provide accommodations for taking a nap for tourists and climbers who want to pray to the rising sun from the summit of the mountain.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: They are open during daytime (10 to 16) as a stand and some of them also provide accommodations for taking a nap for tourists and climbers who want to pray to the rising sun from the summit of the mountain.

They are open during daytime (10 to 16) as a stand and some of them also provide accommodations for taking a nap for tourists and climbers who want to pray to the rising sun from the summit of the mountain.

sen.j: そのため、深夜・未明の仮眠受付も可能となっている。
sen.e: So, it is available for them to stay in these huts for taking a nap in the middle of the night or before dawn.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: So, it is available for them to stay in these huts for taking a nap in the middle of the night or before dawn.
So, it is available for them to stay in these huts for taking a nap in the middle of the night or before dawn.

sen.j: 登山コースは数コースある。
sen.e: There are several courses for climbing.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: There are several courses for climbing.
There are several courses for climbing.

sen.j: 最も一般的なのは米原市側の伊吹山スキー場から登るコースである。
sen.e: Starting to climb at Mt. Ibuki ski resort on the Maibara City side is the most common course.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Starting to climb at Mt. Ibuki ski resort on the Maibara City side is the most common course.
Starting to climb at Mt. Ibuki ski resort on the Maibara City side is the most common course.

sen.j: なお、この登山道は滋賀県道268号伊吹山上野線に指定されているが自動車通行は当然不可能である。
sen.e: This climbing trail is designated as Shiga prefectural road 268, Ibukiyama Ueno route, but automotive traffic is of course impossible.
This climbing trail is designated as Shiga prefectural road 268, Ibukiyama Ueno route, but automotive traffic is of course impossible.
This climbing trail is designated as Shiga prefectural road 268, Ibukiyama Ueno route, but automotive traffic is of course impossible.

sen.j: 3合目までは索道や自家用車で登るのが一般的である。
sen.e: It is common that people climb to the third station on the path of the mountain by aerial lift or car.
It is common that people climb to the third station on the path of the mountain by aerial lift or car.
It is common that people climb to the third station on the path of the mountain by aerial lift or car.

sen.j: 途中5合目には売店小屋、6合目には避難小屋がある。
sen.e: On their way to the top, there is a stand on the fifth station and a bothy on the sixth station.
On their way to the top, there is a stand on the fifth station and a shelter on the sixth station.
On their way to the top, there is a stand on the fifth station and a shelter on the sixth station.

sen.j: 昼間の登山だけでなく、ご来光を見るために涼しい夜間に登山することも盛んである。
sen.e: A lot of people climb it not only during daytime but also cool nighttime to pray to the rising sun from the summit of the mountain.
A lot of people climb it not only during daytime but also cool nighttime to pray to the rising sun from the summit of the mountain.
A lot of people climb it not only during daytime but also cool nighttime to pray to the rising sun from the summit of the mountain.

sen.j: 週末などは深夜に伊吹山を見ると、登山道を行く登山者の懐中電灯の列が点々と見られることがある。
sen.e: On weekends, when you look at Mt. Ibuki in the middle of the night, you can see a line of flashlights climbers on the trail have.
On weekends, when you look at Mt. Ibuki in the middle of the night, you can see a line of flashlights climbers on the trail have.
On weekends, when you look at Mt. Ibuki in the middle of the night, you can see a line of flashlights climbers on the trail have.

sen.j: ドライプウェイも夏季は午前3時から通行可能で、ご来光を見る人のニーズに応えている。
sen.e: In the summer, the highway is available from 3 a.m., meeting the needs from climbers who come to pray to the rising sun.
In the summer, the highway is available from 3 a.m., meeting the needs of climbers who come to pray to the rising sun.
In the summer, the highway is available from 3 a.m., meeting the needs of climbers who come to pray to the rising sun.

sen.j: 登山道の3合目付近は野草が多く自生、あるいは植えられている。
sen.e: Around the third station on the trail path, a lot of wild grass is growing or planted.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Around the third station on the trail path, a lot of wild grass is growing or planted.
Around the third station on the trail path, a lot of wild grass is growing or planted.

sen.j: そのため、3合目だけを観光ポイントとして訪問する人もいる。
sen.e: Therefore, some visitors come to only the third station to enjoy seeing these grass or flowers.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Therefore, some visitors come to only the third station to enjoy seeing these grass or flowers.
Therefore, some visitors come to only the third station to enjoy seeing these grass or flowers.

sen.j: 冬場は伊吹山スキー場でスキーやスノーボードを楽しむことができる。
sen.e: In the winter, people can enjoy skiing or snowboarding in Mt. Ibuki ski resort.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: In the winter, people can enjoy skiing or snowboarding in Mt. Ibuki ski resort.
In the winter, people can enjoy skiing or snowboarding in Mt. Ibuki ski resort.

sen.j: しかし、近年は地球温暖化に伴う滑走可能期間の短縮傾向が著しい。
sen.e: However, these days, the available period when people can enjoy sliding become apparently shorter due to global warming.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: However, these days, the available period when people can enjoy sliding become apparently shorter due to global warming.
However, these days, the available period when people can enjoy sliding become apparently shorter due to global warming.
